definition: section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: We must now ask you to settle this account within the next few days.
sentences.chinese: 请你务必在这几日内结清这笔账款。

sentences.english: If any debt becomes overdue, inform the branch head immediately.
sentences.chinese: 如遇应收账款逾期未到帐，立即告知知分公司总经理。

sentences.english: But many companies go broke because of bad receivables.
sentences.chinese: 但是许多公司因为坏的应收账款而破产。

sentences.english: Moreover, the author insists that the quality of toll right is collective receivable account.
sentences.chinese: 此外，笔者认为收费权性质上为将来集合应收账款。

sentences.english: Selling goods on credit cause uncollectible accounts expense to customers who fail to pay their bills.
sentences.chinese: 坏账损失是由于赊销给无力支付账款的客户而形成的。

sentences.english: Responsible for the management of accounts payables.
sentences.chinese: 负责应付账款账务管理。

sentences.english: They kept dunning us about the overdue bill.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直在向我们催讨过期的账款。

sentences.english: The main part of the enterprise's accounts is accounts receivable and accounts payable.
sentences.chinese: 企业往来款的主要部分为应收账款和应付账款。

sentences.english: The main part of the enterprise's accounts is accounts receivable and accounts payable.
sentences.chinese: 企业往来款的主要部分为应收账款和应付账款。
会计或应付账款相关知识。

sentences.english: Sit down with your accountant or bookkeeper to prioritize your payables.
sentences.chinese: 和您的会计师坐下来商谈您的应付账款。

sentences.english: So we could owe money, and the best example that's account payable .
sentences.chinese: 应付账款就是我们欠钱的最好的例子。

sentences.english: She blundered when she added up the bill.
sentences.chinese: 她把账款相加时弄错了。

sentences.english: Credit conditions mainly refers to enterprise customers will be asked to pay the conditions of the credit payment.
sentences.chinese: 信用条件主要指企业要求客户支付赊销账款的条件。
应付账款都记录些什么？

definition: (of a sum of money etc) receivable
